issue.title: Merge v0.10 into v1.x
issue.body:
R=@saghul

This breaks the fs_fstat test on Linux and only in the gyp build because neither _BSD_SOURCE, _SVID_SOURCE or _XOPEN_SOURCE seem to be defined.  Still investigating that.

```
$ out/Debug/run-tests fs_fstat fs_fstat
Assertion failed in ../test/test-fs.c on line 1081: s->st_atim.tv_nsec == t.st_atim.tv_nsec
Aborted (core dumped)
```

body: According to git-bisect, I broke it myself in commit d6464c8 ('build: remove _GNU_SOURCE macro definition').  That was well over a year ago, though; it seems implausible that no one noticed until now.

issue.title: 1.0.0-rc2 failed test: spawn_reads_child_path
issue.body:
Fails both running as root and user (if relevant). This is linux 3.17.1 x86_64 with glibc 2.19 and built with gcc 4.8.3:

```
`spawn_reads_child_path` failed: exit code 6
Output from process `spawn_reads_child_path`:
exit_cb
Assertion failed in test/test-spawn.c on line 66: exit_status == 1
```

body:
Hum, I cannot reproduce it here:

```
$ file out/Debug/run-tests 
out/Debug/run-tests: ELF 64-bit LSB executable, x86-64, version 1 (SYSV), dynamically linked (uses shared libs), for GNU/Linux 2.6.32, BuildID[sha1]=0360e5e5fd898bd06c5cc68ce14d840387757099, not stripped
$ uname -a
Linux alpha 3.16.0-4-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 3.16.7-2 (2014-11-06) x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

I have an inkling that it has to do glibc.  My system has glibc 2.20 and yours has (I'm guessing) 2.19.  Feature detection was reworked recently ([example](https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=498afc54dfee41d33ba519f496e96480badace8e)); we may be experiencing fallout from that.

I had some fallout due to glibc upgrades on another project. Not sure this applies to this particular case, but this gave me some insight: https://sourceware.org/glibc/wiki/Release/2.20#Packaging_Changes.

issue.title: fs_fstat test fails in 1.3.0
issue.body:
When building version 1.3.0 on ArchLinux (gcc 4.9.2, glibc 2.20) the `fs_stat` test fails like this:

```
`fs_fstat` failed: exit code 134
Output from process `fs_fstat`:
Assertion failed in test/test-fs.c on line 1107: s->st_atim.tv_nsec == 0
```

body: @bnoordhuis is this one also fixed by https://github.com/libuv/libuv/commit/fd3cf20a37b95fe8a3cb4be045b5a1bad9e53cde ?
Yes, sorry.  I knew there was another issue somewhere but I couldn't find it in the rush of things.  Fixed by fd3cf20, closing.

issue.title: async.c:149: uv__async_io: Assertion `n == sizeof(val)' failed
issue.body: I am getting this error at random times. Sometimes Node will run for days without this error, but other times I will get it back to back in a short period of time.  I have seen comments to the effect that it is there to catch programming errors or unexpected conditions and that it one case it was someone's misuse of an API, but I can not find where anyone has elaborated on what the issue actually was or what types of errors cause it. Any help with tracking this down and determining if it is an error in my code or in another component would be greatly appreciated.
